metadata.title: The role of renal dipeptidyl peptidase-4 in kidney disease: renal effects of dipeptidyl peptidase-4 inhibitors with a focus on linagliptin

abstract.original_text: Emerging evidence suggests that dipeptidyl peptidase-4 (DPP-4) inhibitors used to treat type 2 diabetes may have nephroprotective effects beyond the reduced renal risk conferred by glycemic control. DPP-4 is a ubiquitous protein with exopeptidase activity that exists in cell membrane-bound and soluble forms.

sentences.segment_text: Emerging evidence suggests that dipeptidyl peptidase-4 ( DPP-4 ) inhibitors used to treat type 2 diabetes may have nephroprotective effects beyond the reduced renal risk conferred by glycemic control .
DPP-4 is a ubiquitous protein with exopeptidase activity that exists in cell membrane-bound and soluble forms .
